description: The living conditions at Creekside Forest Apartment Homes have drawn public outrage in recent weeks...
title: South DeKalb apartment saga continues
title_page: South DeKalb apartment saga continues — with fugitive landl
text:
The living conditions at Creekside Forest Apartment Homes have drawn public outrage in recent weeks as officials try to get the south DeKalb complex cleaned up.
A judge this week issued a warrant for the arrest of the owner, Chester Meisel, after he didn’t show to a hearing on 338 code violations.
On Friday morning, DeKalb police responded to the crime-plagued complex, this time in search of Meisel. An officer pulled over a man driving down Ember Drive, but it was an Atlanta Journal-Constitution reporter, whom a 911 caller had apparently mistaken as the owner.
Creekside Forest Apartment Homes shown in early September. JOSHUA SHARPE/JOSHUA.SHARPE@AJC.COM
The AJC, which has been covering the situation in recent weeks, had just filmed a Facebook Live video at the complex on Ember Drive. That’s the video above, which can be viewed along with all the reader comments here.
